inputs.remark:
缺少 V2、V3。
V1: Behavioral Central Auditory Tests 缺少 Frequency Patterns (FP) 测试结果；Competing Sentences 左耳应为 65% 而非 35%。
V2：ABR 右耳应修正为 "Waves I, III, V present"（latencies: I=1.7ms, III=3.7ms, V=5.9ms），而非 "Waves I, II, III present"。
V3（影像学检查）。

logic_summary: Restructured investigations into V1 (Audiometry/Behavioral), V2 (Electrophysiology), and V3 (Imaging) as requested.
V1: Updated Behavioral Central Auditory Tests to include Frequency Patterns (normal) and corrected Competing Sentences LE score to 65%.
V2: Moved ABR and MLR from V1. Updated ABR Right Ear result to specify Waves I, III, V present with latencies.
V3: Added Radiologic and Surgical Findings.

value.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrates a moderate-to-severe bilateral symmetrical sensorineural hearing loss with excellent speech recognition, likely presbycusic. Behavioral central tests show significant left-sided deficits (dichotic digits, competing sentences) and bilateral temporal processing issues.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Moderate to severe bilaterally symmetrical sensorineural hearing loss, sloping from mild in low frequencies to severe in high frequencies.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Excellent speech recognition scores bilaterally (RE 92%, LE 96%).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Present at normal levels (reduced sensation levels at mid and high frequencies) bilaterally for 500-4000 Hz.

tests.name: Behavioral Central Auditory Tests
tests.result_summary: Left ear deficit on dichotic digits (~75%), competing sentences (65%), and compressed speech (~45%). Bilaterally suppressed filtered speech scores (~20%). Frequency Patterns (FP) normal bilaterally.

value.collective_interpretation: Electrophysiological testing reveals significant central pathology consistent with a lesion affecting the upper brainstem and thalamus. ABR shows absent waves IV-V on the left, and MLR is absent or poor on the left.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Waves I, III, V present (latencies: I=1.7ms, III=3.7ms, V=5.9ms). Left ear: Normal waves I and II; Wave III delayed; Absence of IV-V complex.

tests.name: Auditory Middle Latency Response (MLR)
tests.result_summary: Noisy/poor responses. T3 (left temporal) showed no repeatable response. T4 (right temporal) showed response to right ear stimulation only.

value.collective_interpretation: Radiologic and surgical findings confirmed the presence of a tumor.

tests.name: Radiologic and Surgical Findings
tests.result_summary: CT scans were difficult to read. Surgery revealed a tumor in the hypothalamus behind the optic chiasm (approx 1.5 cm), affecting the inferior thalamus. Pathology: Glioblastoma multiforme.
